author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In London's heart, the metals doth decline,
China's desire weak, in markets it doth twine.
As Loki's trickery, nerves they undermine,
Gold and ores fall, ‘gainst uncertainty they pine.

Barratt's gauntlet cast, in sales they retreat,
Profits forecast surpassed, yet forward sales they cheat.
Like Thor, his hammer missed, the future less sweet,
In the year's new maw, lesser bounties they'll meet.

Now China's dragon roars, decreeing a ban,
No Apple's gift for them, in this foreign plan.
Like Odin's wisdom lost, their reliance they scan,
On foreign wares they toss, begins a new span.

feedItems.title: Metals Slip as China Demand Worries Linger
feedItems.description: Base metals and gold prices edged lower in early London trade, as worries around the Chinese economy continued to dominate sentiment.

feedItems.title: Barratt Forward Sales Slide
feedItems.description: Barratt Developments posted an above-forecast adjusted profit of £884 million for the full-year but reported total forward sales sharply below the figure in 2022.

feedItems.title: China Bans iPhone Use for Government Officials at Work
feedItems.description: The directive is the latest step in Beijing’s campaign to cut reliance on foreign technology and could hurt Apple’s business in the country.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Within the market's lively court, the dollar holds fame,
A saga of its steep ascent, its valor remains the same.
Even if the surveys falter, draught of losses shall not claim,
For DZ's wise seers foretell no reversal in its game.

Lo, the Eurozone doth stir, its bond yields arise,
E'er higher they shall grace the sky, the ECB surmise.
The hawk's word in Handelsblatt, wisdom thus apprise,
Forecasting an abiding high, ere the fall guile lies.

In the face of storm's fierce breath and trouble in the sky,
Norwegian Air, on wings of faith, hath chosen to fly high.
Up by seven full points three, their fortunes seem to lie,
In autumn's book of reservations, waning not but nigh.

feedItems.title: Dollar Should Stay Strong After Tuesday's Steep Gains
feedItems.description: The dollar should hold on to most of Tuesday’s gains, DZ Bank Research said, adding that even if the service purchasing managers surveys are weaker than expected they are “unlikely to trigger a complete reversal of yesterday’s losses in EUR/USD.”

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Rise as ECB Looks Set for Higher-for-Longer Rates
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bond yields edged higher after Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel hinted at higher-for-longer interest rates in an interview with German newspaper Handelsblatt, RBC Capital Markets said.

feedItems.title: Norwegian Air Positive on Autumn Sales
feedItems.description: Norwegian Air Shuttle said passenger numbers rose 7.3% in August, despite a storm in Norway and the traffic control issues in the U.K. affecting operations, and added the booking momentum for the months ahead looked positive.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
From German lands, a downfall doth loom,
In factories, no orders do bloom,
With numbers much swelled,
The goats are compelled,
To bemoan such economic gloom.

Where Eastern dragons claim the sky,
In the realm of stocks, their fortunes lie,
Rabbits they wait,
In a pondering state,
As property's star ascends high.

Now to the East, where samurais dwell,
A carriage of opulent tell,
Toyota's new steed,
A snail's luxury indeed,
In the market it seeks to excel.

feedItems.title: German Manufacturing Orders Tumble
feedItems.description: New orders at German factories fell 11.7% in July, considerably more than expected, a further indication of declining demand for goods from Europe’s largest economy.

feedItems.title: Chinese Shares End Mixed; Property, Finance Stocks Gain
feedItems.description: Chinese shares ended mixed as traders weighed expectations of more stimulus against continued concerns of an economic slowdown.

feedItems.title: Toyota to Join Global Luxury Car Market With $170,000 Flagship Model
feedItems.description: Toyota thinks the world outside of Japan may finally be ready to embrace its six-figure superluxury flagship car.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Agricole's hands, Hiflow now sits and sings,
A wheel'd vessel 'neath Monetary Kings.
Verity sweet as mead in accord, they cope,
In the market's mirth, they kindle Hope.

Shaken, not stirred, McConnell doth stride,
Back to Senate's chamber, no illness to hide.
God's grace, no stroke did the healer decree,
The alehouse of health, he hath found, verily.

"A rise in the east!", the crier doth tell,
Property stocks in China doth swell.
More potent than wine, this hopeful stimulus,
A toast to Beijing, their cup runneth with us.

feedItems.title: Credit Agricole Takes Ownership of Hiflow
feedItems.description: Credit Agricole’s consumer-finance arm has bought a stake in Hiflow that gives it majority ownership in the vehicle-delivery company and agreed a cooperation deal.

feedItems.title: McConnell Returns to Senate After Health Scares
feedItems.description: Congress’s top doctor says the Senate minority leader didn’t suffer a stroke.

feedItems.title: Chinese Property Stocks Jump Amid Hopes for More Stimulus
feedItems.description: Chinese property stocks jumped amid hopes of more property-market stimulus ahead and a state-owned media report saying Beijing might roll out new measures to shore up the sector.
